clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation for Restoration of Erectile Dysfunction After Cardioversion Treatment Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation for Restoration of Erectile Dysfunction After Cardioversion Treatment Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Erectile and Cognitive function by using the questionnaire and assessment form before sinus conversion

detailed_description.textblock: Sinus conversion by electrical cardioversion increase cardiac output and systemic perfusion. According to recent reports, maintenance of sinus rhythm increase systemic perfusion which leads to improve renal function. Therefore, we hypothesized that sinus conversion of patients with atrial fibrillation will increase systemic perfusion which might improve the erectile dysfunction and cognitive dysfunction.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Erectile dysfunction 1 year after conversion to sinus rhythm.
primary_outcome.description: The changes of erectile function by using official questionnaire-The International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF)-5 1 year after conversion to sinus rhythm.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: cognitive dysfunction 1 year after conversion to sinus rhythm
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of cognitive function by using validated assessment form-The Montreal Cognitive Assessement(MoCA) 1 year after conversion to sinus rhythm

arm_group.description: The changes of erectile function by using official questionnaire-The International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF)-5 1 year after conversion to sinus rhythm.

intervention.description: The changes of erectile function by using official questionnaire-The International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF)-5 1 year after conversion to sinus rhythm. The changes of cognitive function by using validated assessment form-The Montreal Cognitive assessment (MoCA) 1 year after conversion to sinus rhythm.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are scheduled to rhythm control of persistent atrial fibrillation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled to electrical cardioversion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients have taken any medication for erectile dysfunction or who have got any operation already or are scheduled to do.
- More than moderate degree of cognitive dysfunction
